results.abstract: Science teachers are using a new edition of “The Martian” to teach physics, astronomy and chemistry. It’s the same story — minus the profanity.

media.copyright: Carlos Gonzalez for The New York Times
media.caption: David Beck, a science teacher at Oak Middle School in Los Alamitos, Calif., checking students’ assignments. After reading “The Martian” two years ago, “I thought, I could teach all of my eighth-grade physical science out of this book,” he said.

results.adx_keywords: Education (K-12);Books and Literature;Science and Technology;Weir, Andy (1972- );The Martian (Book)
results.title: Andy Weir’s Best Seller ‘The Martian’ Gets a Classroom-Friendly Makeover

results.abstract: Pacific Island governments and others are working to modernize cultivation of kava, hoping that the drink’s popularity can be sustained.
